channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Wiz walks away from $23 billion deal with Google, will pursue IPO
item.description: It would have been Google's largest ever acquisition, but the company has chosen to pursue an IPO rather than an acquisition.

item.title: Here's why China was largely unaffected by Friday's IT outage
item.description: While businesses in the U.S. and Europe woke up Friday to a global IT outage that disrupted airports and hotels, China went into its weekend largely unaffected.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets trade mixed after Wall Street gains; India budget on deck
item.description: Later Tuesday, India is slated to unveil its first budget under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's third five-year term.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Wall Street looks past political uncertainty
item.description: S&P 500 clocks best day since early June. Republicans call on CrowdStrike CEO to testify. Buffett sell $1.5 billion BofA stake.

item.title: Tesla reports second-quarter earnings on Tuesday and investors want a robotaxi update
item.description: Tesla's second-quarter earnings call promise insight into CEO Elon Musk's priorities after it reported its biggest revenue drop since 2012 in the first quarter.

item.title: Korean Air orders at least 40 Boeing wide-body planes in a vote of confidence for the manufacturer
item.description: Korean Air gave Boeing a vote of confidence with an order of at least 40 wide-body planes.

item.title: CrowdStrike shares tumble as fallout from global tech outage continues
item.description: A faulty CrowdStrike software update was still impacting computers on Monday. The incident could hurt signings, Guggenheim Securities analysts warned.

item.title: Ether ETFs appear set to launch on Tuesday, six months after massive debut for bitcoin funds
item.description: The new funds are expected to begin trading as soon as Tuesday.

item.title: Google cancels plans to kill off cookies for advertisers
item.description: The latest change comes after several delays to find an alternative for its Chrome browser

item.title: Republican representatives call on CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz to testify
item.description: Republican representatives called on CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz to testify about its defective software update.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery tells NBA it intends to match Amazon's media rights package
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery intends to use its matching rights on a package of NBA games earmarked for Amazon.

item.title: Markets could unwind the 'Trump trade' after Biden drops out of presidential race
item.description: While Vice President Kamala Harris jumps into the race late in the campaign cycle, some experts said she could head into November with serious momentum.

item.title: Secret Service chief needs to go, Republican and Democrat leaders say after brutal hearing
item.description: Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle has refused to resign on the heels of the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump at a campaign rally.

item.title: Delta cancels hundreds more flights in struggle to recover from Microsoft outage
item.description: Delta is struggling to recover from a global IT outage even as its competitors have largely returned to normal operations.

item.title: Ryanair shares tumble 17.2% as budget airline reports 46% fall in quarterly profit, sees lower fares
item.description: Ryanair shares slid after the company said its quarterly profit after tax had fallen 46% and fares will be lower than expected in the summer months.

item.title: Trump faces a tighter race with Kamala Harris set to replace Biden, experts say
item.description: Kamala Harris's likely nomination to the top of the Democratic ticket throws Trump into a much tighter and uncertain Presidential race, some experts say.

item.title: Britain's Labour faces an uphill battle as it looks to rein in AI's key players
item.description: The U.K. was expected to introduce formal legislation for artificial intelligence this week — but that didn't happen. Now, all eyes are on what happens next.

item.title: Global leaders react to 'true friend' Biden dropping out of U.S. presidential race
item.description: Foreign leaders reacted to U.S. President Joe Biden's decision to exit the presidential race.

item.title: Boeing 'disappointed' customers but is on the path to 'transformational change,' commercial jet CEO says
item.description: Boeing's troubled 737 Max has been at the center of a safety crisis at the company after a door plug blew out midair earlier this year.

item.title: The CrowdStrike fail and next global IT meltdown already in the making
item.description: The best defense against the next CrowdStrike is requiring software updates to be rolled out incrementally and building redundancy into systems.

item.title: The 'Trump trade' is on pause. Political uncertainty is now in the driver's seat
item.description: In a column for CNBC Investing Club subscribers, Jim Cramer examines the investment impact of President Joe Biden withdrawing from the 2024 presidential race.

item.title: Microsoft, CrowdStrike IT outage hits global supply chain, with air freight facing days or weeks to recover
item.description: Crowdstrike global IT outage hits the heart of the global supply chain, with air freight, rails, ports and trucking in the U.S. and beyond down.

item.title: 'Ready to step up': VP Harris gains Capitol Hill cheerleaders as Biden isolates with Covid
item.description: President Biden has faced growing pressure from Democrats to drop out of the race after his June debate flop against Donald Trump.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts are confident about the potential behind these 3 stocks
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service pinpoints Wall Street's best-performing stocks, including Costco and Nvidia

item.title: How a software update from cyber firm CrowdStrike caused one of the world’s biggest IT blackouts
item.description: A fault with an update issued by cybersecurity company CrowdStrike led to a cascade effect among global IT systems Friday.

item.title: Xiaomi launches first flip phone at just over $800, with a $70 portable printer
item.description: The Mix Flip starts at 5,999 yuan ($825), the Chinese company announced.

item.title: Stock exchanges operating normally, issue with FTSE Russell indexes resolved amid global outage
item.description: A massive IT outage that is causing global disruptions apparently won't hold up business as usual in financial markets.

item.title: SunPower stock collapses below $1 as company halts leases, installations and shipments
item.description: SunPower's stock has fallen more than 40% this week as the company may be nearing its end as an operating business.

item.title: Ukraine risks North and South Korea-like division, says former Singapore diplomat
item.description: Russia's war on Ukraine could end with the latter being divided into two — like North and South Korea, says Singapore's former ambassador to Russia, Bilarhari Kausikan.

item.title: In the face of trade tensions, China says it will focus on its own economy
item.description: Top Chinese officials on Friday emphasized the country would focus on its own affairs in the face of rising trade tensions.
